info.name: Arcadier API v2.0 Copy
info.description:
Authentication ============== Our APIs use the [**Bearer token**](https://learning.postman.com/docs/sending-requests/authorization/#bearer-token) authorization method. The "token" in question is a text string. Each persona (Buyer, Seller, Admin, Sub-Buyer and Sub-Merchants) on a marketplace possesses a unique token that enables them to use the APIs. This "token" can be obtained in 2 ways: 1. Authentication API The [Log In/Get Admin Token API](https://apiv2.arcadier.com/#546294a8-cf01-4543-a994-5929c5be2c41) responds with user's `access_token` which can be used as token to authenticate our APIs. 2. A cookie present in the session of a user logged in on a marketplace The token within the cookie can be viewed by logging in to any page (including the Admin portal) as a registered user. * Log in to any user's account on the marketplace (this can also be the admin portal) * Right click on the page * Click "Inspect" * Once the Chrome Dev Tools open, go the the `Application` tab, then click on the `Cookies` dropdown, and find the 'webapitoken' cookie. That cookie's value is the user's token. Alternatively, you can use JavaScript in your Plug-In to fetch the value of the 'webapitoken' cookie mentionned above. ```javascript var token = getCookie('webapitoken'); var settings = { "url": "", "method": "", "headers": { "Content-Type": "application/json", "Authorization": "Bearer " + token //notice the space character between "Bearer" and token }, "data": "" //JSON object }; $.ajax(settings).done(function(response) { console.log(response); }); function getCookie(name){ var value = '; ' + document.cookie; var parts = value.split('; ' + name + '='); if (parts.length === 2) { return parts.pop().split(';').shift(); } } ``` ## Using the token in Postman Once you have the token, you can prepend "Bearer " to it and use that as authorization in Arcadier's APIs. Arcadier's Postman collection already handles this for you. Once you obtain the token value, replace the `{{admintoken}}` placeholder with that value. (Don't forget space between "Bearer" and the token) ![Endpoint Example](https://bootstrap.arcadier.com/github/endpoint%20example.png) Alternatively, you can give fixed values to these placeholders and make them act as variables. Click on [![Run in Postman](https://run.pstmn.io/button.svg)](https://app.getpostman.com/run-collection/346b915f84ec00600260) to download Postman with Arcadier's API collection When the download is complete, click on "Manage Environments" on the top right

Click on the "Add" button ![Add Button](https://bootstrap.arcadier.com/github/Manage%20environment%20box.png) Fill it up with the following variables, a paste your token's value in the "admintoken" row, in the "CURRENT VALUE" column. ![Variables List](https://bootstrap.arcadier.com/github/variable%20list.png) You can extend the same logic to all the other variables to make playing around with several APIs a much less tedious experience. Pagination ========== All APIs that return an array/list of records will have the option to paginate the results obatined. Pagination can be done via query parameters in the URL. Definition from [techtarget.com](https://whatis.techtarget.com/definition/pagination): > "...pagination also refers to the automated process of adding consecutive numbers to identify the sequential order of pages. Some types of website content benefit from being broken into separate pages to make them more user-friendly, such as search engine results pages (SERP), blogs and discussion forums." In Arcadier's APIs: `pageSize` specifies the number of results to display within 1 response. `pageNumber` specifies the page number If an API reports `"TotalRecords": 20`, then * `?pageNumber=1&pageSize=10` will make the API respond with the first 10. * `?pageNumber=2&pageSize=10` will make the API respond with the next 10. * `?pageNumber=1&pageSize=20` will make the API respond with all of the 20. **Note**: Our APIs accept a `pageSize` of maximum value **500**. In Arcadier API responses. * It is advised to use extra filters when doing searches. * If the intention is to get 100% of Records, where the number of Records exceed 500, combine `pageSize` with `pageNumber` and do a couple of API calls. Some APIs that use pagination: * [Get All Users](https://apiv2.arcadier.com/?version=latest#5282732e-0930-43b5-b98f-eeb3d5ce94b8) * [Item Search APIs](https://apiv2.arcadier.com/?version=latest#75cfc057-f670-4c92-b07a-312acafd6fd4) * [Transaction History APIs](https://apiv2.arcadier.com/?version=latest#fd876791-d71f-43bd-be02-bfe6bf17747a) User IDs ======== Admin, Merchant and Buyer ID's can be found by inspecting the page when logged in as each of them. ```html ``` API Changelog ================= All past and upcoming changes in our APIs will be documented in our [API Changelog](https://arcadier.github.io/API-Changelog). Frequently Asked Questions ========================== You can visit our [Developer Community Support](https://github.com/Arcadier/Developer-Community-Support/issues) to view FAQ's and issues reported by developers. You can also submit your own questions, bug reports and feature requests.

item.name: Authentication & SSO

request.description:
This API takes a User ID from an external platform, to create and/or log that same user on your marketplace.

If `"ExternalUserId"` (required) is sent for the first time, the API will create that user and the response will contain its Arcadier "UserId" and an "access_token". (See Example response to the right).

If `"Email"` (optional) is also sent during this first time call, the new user account will be created with that email as **Notification Email**.

> Note: The newly created account will be a buyer account 
  

Otherwise, if `ExternalUserId` is sent again, after having it's account created, the API will simply respond with its Arcadier "UserId" and an "access_token" for API access.

#### Using SSO for seamless logins

The response from the SSO API contains the field `"SsoCode"` which can be used in the following URL to log the user on Arcadier's marketplaces:

`{marketplace-URL}/account/signintodomain?code={SsoCOde}&returnUrl={any-valid-URL-slug}`

This removes the need for a user to define & use a username/password to login to your Arcadier marketplace.

The `"returnURL"` query parameter defines the page on which you would want your users to be redirected to after a successful SSO login. Example, `"/cart"` to redirect your users straight to their cart page after successfuly logging in via SSO.

#### Authentication

> Admin only

response.name: Single Sign-On
Single Sign-On (Enterprise only)

urlencoded.description: Found in the account setttings of your marketplace
Found in the account setttings of your marketplace

request.description:
The Client ID and Client Secret are used to either:
* Retrieve the admin token
* Log a user in

The [**Client ID** and **Client Secret**](https://api.arcadier.com/api-item/auth) of your marketplace can be found in the Admin portal; just navigate to `Account Settings` then `Account Info`.

#### Retrieving Admin ID and admin token
Parameters needed: `client_id: xxx`, `client_secret: xxx`, `grant_type: client_credentials`, `scope: admin`

#### Logging a user in
Parameters needed: `client_id: xxx`, `client_secret: xxx`, `grant_type: password`, `scope: admin`, `username: (username/email of user)` and `password: (password of user)`

Since this API uses sensitive information like the [**Client ID** and **Client Secret**](https://api.arcadier.com/api-item/auth), it is not recommended that this API is called from a client like a browser (Example: of vulnerability: if called using jQuery on a browser, the request headers can be easily discovered and retrieved by anyone).

response.name: Get Admin Token

urlencoded.description: Found in the account setttings of your marketplace
Found in the account setttings of your marketplace
"admin" for Administrator token. "basic" for merchant/buyer token

request.description:
This API ends the session of a user using his/her [authentication token](https://apiv2.arcadier.com/?version=latest#intro).

#### Authentication
> Valid token of an ongoing session

response.name: Log Out

item.description:
Our APIs use the "Bearer + Token" authentication method. Each user on every marketplace has a unique token, which remains valid for 3 hours and is refreshed after that...

How to get the token? See [Authentication](https://apiv2.arcadier.com/?version=latest#authentication) above.

More detailed information about how to get Client ID and Client Secret can be found [here](https://api.arcadier.com/api-item/auth).

request.description:
This API allows the resetting of a user's password by returning a link to Arcadier's reset password page for that user.

Request:

* "UserID" - ID of the user who wants to change their password
* "Action" - "token"  (the string "token", not authentication token).

Response:

* "Url" - URL of Arcadier's password reset page
* "Token" - Reset password token to be used in [Update User Password API](https://apiv2.arcadier.com/?version=latest#39756c48-c576-4451-9edd-b6825ef789e8)

(More details in example on the right)

#### Authentication
> Admin token only

response.name: Reset Password

request.description:
This API resets the password of a buyer/merchant in 2 ways:

* A user has not forgotten their password but wants to change it:
 * In this scenario, `"OldPassword"` is required.
 * `"ResetPasswordToken"` is **not** required.
* A user has forgotten their password, and wants to reset it:
 * In this scenario, `"OldPassword"`is **not** required.
 * `"ResetPasswordToken"` is required, and is obtained from [Reset User Password API](https://apiv2.arcadier.com/?version=latest#12e8be69-7939-48f0-b8b5-ce25b001d9ed)

In the event of a successful change, the response will be:
```json
{
	Result: true
}
```

#### Authentication
> Password change: Admin token
>
> Password Reset: Admin token

response.name: Reset User Password
Update User Password

query.description: Specifying this parameter will also include the addresses of the user in the response.

request.description:
Calling this API will get all available information of the user ID you provided.

#### Authentication
> None required

query.description: Merchant role only
Filter users using a keyword. The matches returned may have the keyword in their username/email/firstName/lastName.
The number of results displayed per API call.
The page number

request.description:
Gets the list of all merchants, with a default `pageSize` of `24`. This can be changed in the query parameters. Search results can be filtered using `keywords`

#### Authentication
> Admin token only

response.name: Get all merchants

query.description: The number of results displayed
The page number
Admin, merchant, buyer

query.description: Admin, merchant, buyer
Filter users using a keyword. The matches returned may have the keyword in their username/email/firstName/lastName.
The number of results displayed
The page number

request.description:
Gets the list of all merchants, with a default `pageSize` of `24`. This can be changed in the query parameters. Search results can be filtered using `keywords`.

#### Authentication
> Admin token only

response.name: Get all merchants

query.description: The number of results displayed

request.description:
**Upgrades** the role of the userID specified in URL.

There are 4 roles, in ascending power:
* User - the person that buys (buyer)
* Merchant - the person that sells (seller)
* Admin - the person that controls the marketplace
* Owner - the owner of the marketplace

If you are a merchant you will be both "Merchant" and "User".
The owner can be all 4.
An admin can be "Admin" and "Merchant", or "Admin" and "User"

Values taken by {{role}}: "merchant", "Admin"

#### Authentication
> Admin token only

response.name: Delete a user

request.description:
This API sends email invitations to users specified in the request body array. The emails will generate a token, and allows the users to create a sub-account under the main account {userID}.

**Request Parameters**:
* "Name" - Name of the account to invite
* "Email" - Email address of the user to invite
* "RegistrationType" possible values: 
  * "Admin" - for sub admin account if {userID} is set to admin ID
  * "MerchantSubAccount" - for sub-merchant account
  * "BuyerSubAccount" - for sub-buyer account

**Response fields**
* "Name" - Name of the user
* "Email" - Email recipient of the user
* "Token": The token to be used in [Register Invited Sub-Account]()
* "CreatedDateTime" - Unix timestamp of invitation
* "ModifiedDateTime" - Unix timestamp of invitation update
* "RegistrationType" - The sub-account type registered.

#### Authentication
> Admin token only

[

        "Name": "John Smith",
        "Email": "john@smith.com",

        "CreatedDateTime": 1609217191,
        "ModifiedDateTime": 1609217191,
        "Active": true,
        "RegistrationType": "BuyerSubAccount"
    }
]

request.description:
After receiving the token from the [Invite Sub Account API](https://apiv2.arcadier.com/#aa13feb1-1a88-4a2d-887b-cf526e7e99a6), this API can be used to create the sub account, skipping the need for the user to check their email and click on the link the receive.

**Request parameters**:
* "Username" - The username the sub-account user will use on the log in page
* "FirstName" - The first name of the user
* "LastName" - The last name of the user
* "Password" - The login password of the sub-account
* "ConfirmPassword" - A repeat of the login password of the sub-account
* "Email" - The notification email of the sub-account
* "Token" - The token received from [Invite Sub Account API](https://apiv2.arcadier.com/#aa13feb1-1a88-4a2d-887b-cf526e7e99a6)
* "IsSeller" - *(Boolean)* Set to true if the sub-account is meant to be a sub-merchant account. Set to false if it is meant to be a sub-buyer account.

**Response fields**
* "UserId" - The user GUID for the newly created account
* "access_token" - The authorization token that can be used to authorize that user for API calls. Not needed if you are authorizing API calls with admin token.
* "expires_in" - the amount of time (in seconds) for which "access_token" will be valid.

#### Authentication
> Admin token only

request.description:
Links an existing normal account as a Sub-Account under another normal account.

**Request Parameters**
* "AccountOwnerId" - The main parent account
* "AccountID" - The account to convert to a sub-account
* "RegistrationType" - Takes one of the following values:
  * "BuyerSubAccount" - For the sub-account to be a sub-buyer account
  * "MerchantSubAccount" - For the sub-account to be a sub-buyer account

#### Authentication
> Admin token only

response.name: Convert normal account to sSub-Account

request.description:
Converts a sub-account to a normal account. The account to be converted is specified in the {userID} query parameter in the API URL.

{current-sub-role} is the current role of the sub-account you want to convert:
* `submerchant` - for sub-merchant accounts
* `subbuyer` - for sub-buyer accounts 

#### Authentication
> Admin token only

item.description:
The addresses involved in these APIs include:
* Residential addresses
* Delivery addresses
* Pickup addresses

Different authorisations are given in those APIs.

item.name: Marketplace

request.description:
**NOTE: THIS DOES NOT CREATE CUSTOM DOMAINS.**
This API allows you to customize the URL **slug** of any default URL **slug** on a marketplace. 

You can input the URL slug in `"Value"`, and input your preferred shortened URL in "`Key`". 

For example:

Default URL for an item's detail page: 

- your-marketplace.arcadier.io**/User/Item/Detail/ShoeMeister/66065**

Preferred URL: 

- your-marketplace.arcadier.io**/ShoeMeister_A**

Request body:
```json
{
    "Key": "/ShoeMeister_A",
    "Value": "/User/Item/Detail/ShoeMeister/66065"
}
```


This also applies to Plug-In files:

Default URL for a PHP/HTML file: 

- your-marketplace.arcadier.io**/user/plugins/12345678-1234-1234-1234-123456789012/custom.php**

Preferred URL: 

- your-marketplace.arcadier.io**/custom**

```json
{
    "Key": "/custom",
    "Value": "/user/plugins/12345678-1234-1234-1234-123456789012/custom.php"
}
```

Or

Default URL for a PHP/HTML file: 

- your-marketplace.arcadier.io**/user/plugins/12345678-1234-1234-1234-123456789012/index.html**

Preferred URL: 

- your-marketplace.arcadier.io**/index**

```json
{
    "Key": "/index",
    "Value": "/user/plugins/12345678-1234-1234-1234-123456789012/index.html"
}
```


#### Authentication
> Admin token only

Gets basic information about the marketplace itself. Custom Fields Names, codes, and contents that have `ReferenceTable: Implementations` can be seen by calling this API.

#### Authentication
> None Required

item.description: These 2 APIs give and update information about the marketplace itself. The most Important use of these APIs would be working with custom fields for plug ins.

request.description:
#### Request Parameters:
* "pageSize" - The number of results per response
* "pageNumber" - The page number according to pagination
* "Keywords" - Keyword term to search
* "Sort":
 * `created` - In ascending order according of time created (oldest first)
 * `-created` - In descending order according of time created (latest first)
 * `updated` - In ascending order according of time updated (oldest first)
 * `-updated` - In descending order according of time updated (latest first)
 * `name` - In ascending alphabetical order
 * `-name` - In descending alphabetical order
 * `price` - In ascending order according to price
 * `-price` - In descending order according to price
* "sellerID" - The seller GUID
* "Categories" - Array of categories to search in. The array contains category GUIDs as strings.
* "CustomFieldQueries" - Array of Custom Field codes and their values
 * `Code` - The custom field code
 * `Operator`:
     * "equal" - exact match
     * "like" - contains the value
     * "in" - one of the given `Values`, separated by a comma (see example request)
     * "lte" - less than or equal to the given `Value`
     * "gte" - greater than or equal to the given `Value`
 * `Value` - the custom field value
* "createdStartDate" - The lower limit of the creation date and time (in unix timestamp)
* "createdEndDate" - The upper limit of the creation date and time (in unix timestamp)
* "updatedStartDate" - The lower limit of the modified date and time (in unix timestamp)
* "updatedEndDate"- The upper limit of the modified date and time (in unix timestamp)
* "minPrice" - the lower limit of the items' price
* "maxPrice" - the upper limit of the items' price


#### Authentication
> None Required

request.description:
Unlike the [Get All Items](https://apiv2.arcadier.com/#c06e85df-93f9-446c-a9b2-426296185d0d) endpoint, this one returns only the details of the item GUIDs you precise.

item.name: Search Users by Custom Field Value

query.description: Items, Orders or Users

request.description:
This API enables you to query Users by their custom fields and custom field values.

Query parameters:
* "referenceTable" - Users
* "pageSize" & "pageNumber" - For pagination

Request parameters:

* "Code" - The custom field code
* "Operator": 
  * "equal" - look for an exact search term
  * "like" - look for custom field values that have a term similar to the search term
  * "lte" - look for custom field values which are **less** than or equal the search term value
  * "gte" - look for custom field values which are **greater** than or equal the search term value
* "Value" - The search term

#### Authentication
> Admin token only

#### Simple query
Querying for a specific value of a custom field:

There's a custom field name called "FAVORITE_FLAVOUR", and you want to search for Users having the "FAVORITE_FLAVOUR" custom field with a value of "CHOCOLATE":

```json
[
    {
        "Code": "FALVOUR-custom-field-code",
        "Operator": "equal",
        "Value": "Chocolate"
    }
]
```

If only one result exists, the response will be:

```json
{
  "TotalRecords": 1,
  "PageNumber": 1,
  "PageSize": 1,
  "Records": [
      "02ec5b74-ecc2-4c9c-9048-dbfc9de419ba"
  ]
}
```
#### AND operation
You want to perform an AND operation on 2 or more custom fields, or a range of AND conditions on the same custom field. E.g: 

1. You have the "HEIGHT" custom field on several items and you want to search for those which are between 1.7 m and 2.2 m:
```json
[
    {
        "Code": "HEIGHT-custom-field-code",
        "Operator": "lte",
        "Value": "2.2"
    },
    {
        "Code": "HEIGHT-custom-field-code",
        "Operator": "gte",
        "Value": "1.7"
    }
]
```

2. You want to search for Users having 2 specific but different custom fields, each one with their own specific value - a "FAVORITE FLAVOUR" of Chocolate and a "HEIGHT" of 2.2m:

```json
[
    {
        "Code": "HEIGHT-custom-field-code",
        "Operator": "equal",
        "Value": "4"
    },
    {
        "Code": "FLAVOUR-custom-field-code",
        "Operator": "equal",
        "Value": "Chocolate"
    }
]
```

The responses will be an array of results similar to the first example.

request.description:
Gets an item's details, including its variants' details.

To get a parent item and/or its variant, there are 2 possible scenarios: 

1. **Getting a parent item and its variants**  
 
     * GET api/v2/items/{{parentItemID}}

2. **Getting a specific child item (a specific variant)**

    * GET api/v2/items/{{ChildItemID}}
    * The API will respond with the details of the corresponding parent item. Search for that parent item ID (as in scenario 1, to get that child item's details)
    
#### Authentication
> None required

request.description:
The same endpoint as [Create Item](https://apiv2.arcadier.com/?version=latest#03d18078-0f46-4c84-b9ff-c464c7853580), but with **3** extra fields that are very specific to Listings/Service Bookings. Those 3 fields are:

**"InstantBuy"** - (boolean) `true` if you want this item to be directly bought, without the need of negotiation.

**"Negotiation"** - (boolean) `true` if you want to enable negotiation (hence, chat channels can be opened between merchant and buyer for this item).

Both **"InstantBuy"** and **"Negotiation"** can be set to `true` simultaneously.

**"Scheduler": { }**
* **"TimeZoneOffset"** and **"TimeZoneID"** - Obtained from the [Static TimeZone API](https://apiv2.arcadier.com/?version=latest#039bb699-d624-401c-bf8b-c44b3ae8721b)
* **"AllDay"**
 * set to `true` if the listing/service operates 24/7 - No need to set **"OpeningHours"**.
 * set to `false` if the listing/service **does NOT** operate 24/7 - *Need* to set **"OpeningHours"**.
* **"Overnight"** 
 * setting this to `true` will allow **"PriceUnit"** to be set to `night`, `week`, `month`, and `custom`.
 * setting this to `false` will allow default **"PriceUnit"** values to be set - `hour`, `day`,`night`, `week`, `month`, and `custom`.
* **"StartDateTime"** and **"EndDateTime"** 
 * They take unix timestamp integer values (E.g: 1587427200), specifying the whole period of duration of the listing.
* **"OpeningHours": []**
 * **"Day"**
   * 1 : Sunday
   * 2 : Monday
   * 3 : Tuesday
   * 4 : Wednesday
   * 5 : Thursday
   * 6 : Friday
   * 7 : Saturday
 * **"StartTime"** and **"EndTime"**
   * Take a string to represent the time period of the day the service is open (E.g: "21:00:00"). See Body example below.
  * **"IsRestDay"**
   * Setting this to `true` will indicate that the service is not available on the Day specified.
* **"Unavailables": []**
 * **"StartDateTime"** and **"EndDateTime"** 
   * They take unix timestamp integer values (E.g: 1587427200), specifying the period of blockout of the listing. 
 * **"Reason"**
   * Takes any string, to record the reason of blocking out that time period.
 * **"Active"**
   * Setting this to `true` will enable the block out, and vice versa.

#### Authentication
> Admin and Merchant token only

request.description:
The same endpoint as [Edit Item](https://apiv2.arcadier.com/#8af9bf27-a3fb-4623-b8d0-f53a67697c47), but with **3** extra fields specific to Listings/Service Bookings. Those 3 fields are:

**"InstantBuy"** - (boolean) `true` if you want this item to be directly bought, without the need of negotiation.

**"Negotiation"** - (boolean) `true` if you want to enable negotiation (hence, chat channels can be opened between merchant and buyer for this item).

Both **"InstantBuy"** and **"Negotiation"** can be set to `true` simultaneously.

**"Scheduler": { }**
* **"Unavailables": []**
 * **"StartDateTime"** and **"EndDateTime"** 
   * They take unix timestamp integer values (E.g: 1587427200), specifying the period of blockout of the listing. 
 * **"Active"**
   * Setting this to `true` will enable the block out, and vice versa.

#### Authentication
> Admin and Merchant token only
Deletes an item from a merchant's inventory

request.description:
Adds a single item to the cart of the buyer.

**Request**

All the parameters are required. If your item has child items, use the child item ID instead of the parent item ID. Otherwise the API will respond with `null`.

If "CartItemType": "delivery", then you can only add:

```
"ShippingMethod": {
        "ID": "46a0896b-482f-453f-acb4-aa39ddc2707d"   (This is the ID of a shipping method that already has been created by the merchant beforehand)
    }
```
 
 **Response**
 
 The "ID" responded is represents a unique identifier for the Item in that cart. It is not the same as the Item ID given by Items API. Each item in the cart will have a unique `Cart Item ID` which is represented by the `ID` in the reponse.
 
 If the response you receive is null, check the item ID you provided. If that item has child items, insert those child items' IDs instead.

#### Authentication
> Buyer token only

response.name: Add item to cart

request.description:
The cart item `ID` can be retrieved using the `Get cart details of user` API
This API can be used with both the PUT and POST methods.
* PUT method with `"Quantity": 3`
  * Change the originial quantity of an item from `x` to `3`
* POST method with `"Quantity": 3`
  * Change the originial quantity of an item from `x` to `x + 3`

If "CartItemType": "delivery", then you can only add:

```
"ShippingMethod": {
        "ID": "46a0896b-482f-453f-acb4-aa39ddc2707d"   (This is the ID of a shipping method that already has been created by the merchant beforehand)
    }
```

If the response you receive is `null`, check the item ID you provided. If that item has child items, insert those child items' IDs instead.

#### Authentication
> Buyer token only

item.name: Checkout
Pre-Checkout

request.description:
Adds a single item to the cart of the buyer.

**Request**

All the parameters are required. If your item has child items, use the child item ID instead of the parent item ID. Otherwise the API will respond with `null`.

You need set `"CartItemType"` to `"delivery"` if you intend to specify the `"ShippingMethod"`.

```
"ShippingMethod": {
        "ID": "46a0896b-482f-453f-acb4-aa39ddc2707d"   (This is the ID of a shipping method that already has been created by the merchant beforehand)
    }
```
 
 **Response**
 
 The "ID" responded is represents a unique identifier for the Item in that cart. It is not the same as the Item GUID. Each item in the cart will have a unique `Cart Item ID` which is represented by the `ID` in the reponse.
 
 *If the response you receive is null, check the item ID you provided. If that item has child items, insert those child items' IDs instead.*

#### Authentication
> Buyer token only

item.description: These APIs are called before having to call your payment gateway's APIs.

item.name: Checking Out
Generate Invoice and Orders from Cart

body.raw:
[
    "Cart item ID 1",
    "Cart item ID 2",
    "Cart item ID 3"
]

request.description:
This API is the next step after using the [Add Item to Cart](https://apiv2.arcadier.com/?version=latest#ff3b5052-d889-4421-b419-942d1be7e19d) API. It responds with all the necessary data to be sent to your Payment Gateway's API. You can see the kind of data it returns in the Example Response on the right.

**Request**

The request body is just an array of the different [Cart Item IDs](https://apiv2.arcadier.com/?version=latest#ff3b5052-d889-4421-b419-942d1be7e19d). In the request body below, there are 3 Cart Item IDs - 3 items were checked out.

**Response**

The response will be an Invoice (for the buyer), and Order(s) for the Merchant(s). Each Order will have information that might be relevant for the payment gateway API.

#### Authentication
> Buyer token only

item.description: The response of this API is what you send to your payment gateway's APIs.

request.description:
This API is for the merchant to use whenever he/she gets confirmation for the following parameters:

### Required Paramaters:

#### FulfilmentStatus: 
* Values taken : `"Delivered"`, `"Acknowledged"`, `"Collected"`, `"Ready For Consumer Collection"`
	* Delivered: The item reached the buyer.
	* Acknowledged: The item has not reached the buyer yet.

#### PaymentStatus:
* Values taken: `"Acknowledged"`, `"Processing"`, `"Waiting For Payment"`, `"Pending"`, `"Paid"`, `"Failed"`, `"Refunded"`
	* Depends on what is the status reported by the payment gateway, or what you decide it to be if you know what's the status of the money movement.

### Optional paramaters:

#### Balance: 
The amount of money that still remains to be paid by the buyer.

* Values taken: `0.00` or any 2 decimal place **positive** number.
* If `"PaymentStatus"` is set to `"Paid"`, then `"Balance"` should be set to 0.00.

####  DeliveryToAddress:

```
"CartItemType": "delivery",
"DeliveryToAddress":{
	"ID": "00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000"
}
```

* `"CartItemType": "delivery"` needs to be set first to be able to set `"DeliveryToAddress": { "ID": "" }` - it will take the address of the buyer.
* Make sure `"PaymentStatus"` was **not already** set to `"Paid"` before updating user address.  

#### Freight
The freight price/shipping fee for that order

* Values taken: `0.00` or any 2 decimal place **positive** number.
	* The value of `"Freight"` will affect the Total and GrandTotal of the whole transaction.

#### DiscountAmount
The discount that needs to be applied to that order.

* Values taken: `0.00` or any 2 decimal place **positive** number.
	* The value of `"Freight"` will affect the Total and GrandTotal of the whole transaction.

#### Surcharge
Any extra amount that needs to be applied to that order.

* Values taken: `0.00` or any 2 decimal place **positive** number.
	* The value of `"Surcharge"` will affect the Total and GrandTotal of the whole transaction.

As customers checkout, the **GrandTotal** of their payment is calculated as shown below:

`GrandTotal` = [(`Price of Item`) x (`Quantity of Item`)] + `Freight` + `Surcharge` - `DiscountAmount`

#### CustomFields
Custom Fields can be tagged to an order using this API. After creating a Custom Field for Orders, a value can be stored in that custom field using this API. More information on Custom Fields can be found [here](https://github.com/Arcadier/Coding-Tutorials/tree/master/Creating%20Custom%20Fields).

#### Authentication
> Admin and Merchant token

request.description:
This Admin API can update the statuses, and buyer delivery addresses of multiple orders in a single call.

This API is for the merchant to use whenever he/she gets confirmation for the following parameters:

### Required Paramaters:

#### FulfilmentStatus: 
* Values taken : `"Delivered"`, `"Acknowledged"`, `"Collected"`, `"Ready For Consumer Collection"`

#### PaymentStatus:
* Values taken: `"Acknowledged"`, `"Processing"`, `"Waiting For Payment"`, `"Pending"`, `"Paid"`, `"Failed"`, `"Refunded"`
	* Depends on what is the status reported by the payment gateway, or what you decide it to be if you know what's the status of the money movement.

### Optional paramaters:

#### Balance: 
The amount of money that still remains to be paid by the buyer.

* Values taken: `0.00` or any 2 decimal place **positive** number.
* If `"PaymentStatus"` is set to `"Paid"`, then `"Balance"` should be set to 0.00.

####  DeliveryToAddress:

```
"CartItemType": "delivery",
"DeliveryToAddress":{
	"ID": "00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000"
}
```

* `"CartItemType": "delivery"` needs to be set first to be able to set `"DeliveryToAddress": { "ID": "" }` - it will take the address of the buyer.
* Make sure `"PaymentStatus"` was **not already** set to `"Paid"` before updating user address.  

#### Freight
The freight price/shipping fee for that order

* Values taken: `0.00` or any 2 decimal place **positive** number.
	* The value of `"Freight"` will affect the Total and GrandTotal of the whole transaction.

#### DiscountAmount
The discount that needs to be applied to that order.

* Values taken: `0.00` or any 2 decimal place **positive** number.
	* The value of `"Freight"` will affect the Total and GrandTotal of the whole transaction.

#### Surcharge
Any extra amount that needs to be applied to that order.

* Values taken: `0.00` or any 2 decimal place **positive** number.
	* The value of `"Surcharge"` will affect the Total and GrandTotal of the whole transaction.

As customers checkout, the **GrandTotal** of their payment is calculated as shown below:

`GrandTotal` = [(`Price of Item`) x (`Quantity of Item`)] + `Freight` + `Surcharge` - `DiscountAmount`

#### CustomFields
Custom Fields can be tagged to an order using this API. After creating a Custom Field for Orders, a value can be stored in that custom field using this API. More information on Custom Fields can be found [here](https://github.com/Arcadier/Coding-Tutorials/tree/master/Creating%20Custom%20Fields).

#### Authentication
> Admin token only

request.description:
Updates Marketplace's databases on payment details received from the payment gateway after a successful/pending/failed transaction has occured.

### Required parameters:
> Payee.ID - merchant GUID
>
> Order.ID - order GUID
>
> Status

#### Status
* Values taken: `"Cancelled"`, `"Failed"`, `"Processing"`, `"Refunded"`, `"Success"`, `"Waiting For Payment"`.
	* After setting `"Status"` to `"Success"` or `"Waiting For Payment"`, the transaction will show up on the Administrator Dashboard.

#### Total & Fee
* `"Total"` and `"Fee"` take the values of the original invoice by default. They can be updated manually.
  * If `"Status"` is set to `"Success"`. Then you can omit `"Total"` and `"Fee"`.

### Optional parameters:
* `"Gateway"` parameters are optional and can take anything.
* `"DateTimePaid"` takes date-time in unix format (seconds from 01/01/1970).



#### Authentication
> Admin token only

request.description:
Creates a chant channel for 2 users: `userID` and `recipientID`. 

`userID` is the GUID of the user who initiates the chat. 

`recipientID` is the user GUID of the user who is the receipient at the time of initiation of the chat channel.

Both `userID` and `receipientID` cannot have the same e-mail address, otherwise, you will receive an error 500 while trying to create the chat channel.

#### Authentication
> Admin token or involved user only

request.description:
This API is for the merchant to use whenever he/she gets confirmation for the following parameters:

### Required Paramaters:

#### FulfilmentStatus: 
* Values taken : `"Delivered"`, `"Acknowledged"`, `"Collected"`, `"Ready For Consumer Collection"`
	* Delivered: The item reached the buyer.
	* Acknowledged: The item has not reached the buyer yet.

#### PaymentStatus:
* Values taken: `"Acknowledged"`, `"Processing"`, `"Waiting For Payment"`, `"Pending"`, `"Paid"`, `"Failed"`, `"Refunded"`
	* Depends on what is the status reported by the payment gateway, or what you decide it to be if you know what's the status of the money movement.

### Optional paramaters:

#### Balance: 
The amount of money that still remains to be paid by the buyer.

* Values taken: `0.00` or any 2 decimal place **positive** number.
* If `"PaymentStatus"` is set to `"Paid"`, then `"Balance"` should be set to 0.00.

####  DeliveryToAddress:

```
"CartItemType": "delivery",
"DeliveryToAddress":{
	"ID": "00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000"
}
```

* `"CartItemType": "delivery"` needs to be set first to be able to set `"DeliveryToAddress": { "ID": "" }` - it will take the address of the buyer.
* Make sure `"PaymentStatus"` was **not already** set to `"Paid"` before updating user address.  

#### Freight
The freight price/shipping fee for that order

* Values taken: `0.00` or any 2 decimal place **positive** number.
	* The value of `"Freight"` will affect the Total and GrandTotal of the whole transaction.

#### DiscountAmount
The discount that needs to be applied to that order.

* Values taken: `0.00` or any 2 decimal place **positive** number.
	* The value of `"DiscountAmount"` will affect the Total and GrandTotal of the whole transaction.

#### Surcharge
Any extra amount that needs to be applied to that order.

* Values taken: `0.00` or any 2 decimal place **positive** number.
	* The value of `"Surcharge"` will affect the Total and GrandTotal of the whole transaction.

As customers checkout, the **GrandTotal** of their payment is calculated as shown below:

`GrandTotal` = [(`Price of Item`) x (`Quantity of Item`)] + `Freight` + `Surcharge` - `DiscountAmount`

#### CustomFields
Custom Fields can be tagged to an order using this API. After creating a Custom Field for Orders, a value can be stored in that custom field using this API. More information on Custom Fields can be found [here](https://github.com/Arcadier/Coding-Tutorials/tree/master/Creating%20Custom%20Fields).

#### Authentication
> Admin and Merchant token

### Required Paramaters:

query.description: (Optional) The number of results per page, integer, default is 24
(Optional) The page number, integer, default is 1
The lower limit of the time frame after which a transaction occured.
The upper limit of the time frame before which a trasnaction occured.
String, default is empty

Sorting the transaction results, String, default is "-id"
Available strings:
"id" => sort payment by id, ascending
"-id" =>  sort payment by id, descending
"invoiceno" => sort payment by invoiceno, ascending
"-invoiceno" =>  sort payment by invoiceno, descending
"datetimepaid" =>  sort payment by datetimepaid, ascending
"-datetimepaid" =>  sort payment by datetimepaid, descending
"datetimecreated" =>  sort payment by datetimecreated, ascending
"-datetimecreated" =>  sort payment by datetimecreated, descending

Payment status of the transaction, String, default is null. 
Available statuses: 
Processing
Pending
Paid
Failed
Refunded
Created
Acknowledged
Waiting For Payment
Invoiced
Overdue
Success
if value is true, it will pull all orders that have refunded item, Boolean, valid values: "null","true","false", default is "null"
The lower limit of the timeframe after which the Order ID was created, DateTime, default is null
The upper limit of the timeframe after which the Order ID was created, DateTime, default is null
The lower limit of the timeframe after which the Order was modified, DateTime, default is null
The upper limit of the timeframe after which the Order was modified, DateTime, default is null

request.description:
This API returns all orders that have been placed on the marketplace. Search results can be filtered using the parameters below.

It is recommended that `pageSize` values are not set to be more than 250.

#### Authentication
> Admin token

response.name: Get Transactions History of marketplace

query.description: (Optional) The number of results per page
(Optional) The page number

item.name: Get Transaction History of a buyer

header.description: This can also be merchant token

query.description: (Optional) The number of results per page, Integer, default is 24
(Optional) The page number, integer, default is 1
String, default is empty
The lower limit of the time frame after which a transaction occured.
The upper limit of the time frame before which a trasnaction occured.

Sorting the transaction results, String, default is "-id"
Available strings:
"id" => sort payment by id, ascending
"-id" =>  sort payment by id, descending
"invoiceno" => sort payment by invoiceno, ascending
"-invoiceno" =>  sort payment by invoiceno, descending
"datetimepaid" =>  sort payment by datetimepaid, ascending
"-datetimepaid" =>  sort payment by datetimepaid, descending
"datetimecreated" =>  sort payment by datetimecreated, ascending
"-datetimecreated" =>  sort payment by datetimecreated, descending

Filter by Payment status of the transaction, String, default is null. 
Available statuses: 
Processing
Pending
Paid
Failed
Refunded
Created
Acknowledged
Waiting For Payment
Invoiced
Overdue
Success
Filter by Order status of the transaction, String, default is null
Filter by Merchant ID, array of guID, default is null

Filter payment records by PaymentDueDateTime, the system checks if paymentduedate is "Upcoming", "Past"
Upcoming => PaymentDueDateTime is greater than or equal to current date
Past=> PaymentDueDateTime is less than current date
Filter by Payment Gateway used in transaction, Array of string, default is null
if value is true, it will pull all orders that have refunded item, Boolean, valid values: "null","true","false", default is "null"
The lower limit of the timeframe after which the Order ID was created, DateTime, default is null
The upper limit of the timeframe after which the Order ID was created, DateTime, default is null
The lower limit of the timeframe after which the Order was modified, DateTime, default is null
The upper limit of the timeframe after which the Order was modified, DateTime, default is null

request.description:
Returns all the transaction done by a user.

#### Authentication
> Admin token only

request.description: Refund ID is the "ID" of the CartItemDetail where "Refund" = "true"

query.description: Integer (Default value: 24)
Integer (Default value: 1)
Boolean (Default value: null)

request.description:
The value of `"Field"` and `"ConditionTyp"` (in "Filters"), `"Field"` (in "SortOrder"), and values in "ReturnFields" array are **NOT** case sensitive.

**Performing an OR operation:**

The request below will look for items with items with "Price" less than "100" OR greater than 2000.
```
{
  "Filters":
    [
      {
        "Field": "Price",
        "Value": "2000",
        "ConditionType":"Gt"
      },
      {
        "Field": "Price",
        "Value": "100",
        "ConditionType":"Lt"
      }
    ]
}
```
**Performing an AND operation**

The request below will look for items with items with "Price" between "100" AND "2000".
```
{
  "Filters":
    [
      {
        "Field": "Price",
        "Value": "2000",
        "ConditionType":"Lt"
      }
    ]
},
{
  "Filters":
   [
     {
       "Field": "Price",
       "Value": "100",
       "ConditionType":"Gt"
     }
   ]
}
```
**Filter "Field" values**
* DateTimeCreated
* OrderStatus
* PaymentStatus
* FulfilmentStatus 
* HasItemRefunded 
* RefundedDateTime 
* MerchantID 
* CustomValue 
* OrderCustomValue

**"ConditionType" values**
* Equal - exact value
* In - Includes that value
* Gte - Greater or equal than the value
* Lte - Less or equal than the value
* Gt - Greater than the value
* Lt - Less than the value

**"SortOrder.Field" values**
* ID - Sort by ID
* InvoiceNo -  Sort by Invoice number
* DateTimePaid - Sort by time invoice was paid
* DateTimeCreated - Sort by time invoice was created

**"SortOrder.Direction" values**
* Ascending
* Descending

**"ReturnFields" values**
* InvoiceNo
* CurrencyCode
* Total
* Fee
* Orders *(this field will return all order fields, if the user wants to customize the order fields in the result, use the following properties)*
* Orders.ID
* Orders.CurrencyCode
* Orders.Total
* Orders.Tax
* Orders.Freight
* Orders.Surcharge
* Orders.Rounding
* Orders.GrandTotal
* Orders.Balance
* Orders.Adjustment
* Orders.Reason
* Orders.OrderType
* Orders.DiscountAmount
* Orders.MerchantDetail
* Orders.ConsumerDetail
* Orders.CartItemDetails
* Orders.PaymentDetails
* Orders.DeliveryFromAddress
* Orders.DeliveryToAddress
* Orders.BillingToAddress
* Orders.FulfilmentStatus
* Orders.PaymentStatus
* Orders.OrderStatus
* Orders.CustomFields
* Orders.DiscountDateTime
* Orders.CreatedDateTime
* Orders.RequisitionDetail
* Orders.PurchaseOrderNo
* Orders.PaymentTerm
* Orders.ReceivingNotes
* Orders.HasPartialRefund
* Orders.TotalPartialRefund
* Orders.OfferDetails
* Orders.Bookings
* Orders.AvailabilitySchedules

> Admin token only

response.name: Get Admin Shipping Methods (Delivery 2.0)

request.description:
Create a shipping methods that can be assigned to items/listings by merchants.

`"Price"` is the delivery fee the delivery takes for a single item. `"CombinedPrice"` is the amount extra it takes for each *additional* item.

Example: 
```json
"Price": 5,
"CombinedPrice": 2
```

Delivery fee for 1 item = $5

Delivery fee for 2 items = 5 + 2 = $7

Delivery fee for 3 items = 5 + 2(2) = $9

Delivery fee for 4 items = 5 + 4(2) = $13



#### Authentication
> Admin and merchant token only

request.description:
Edits details of a shipping method.

`"Price"` is the delivery fee the delivery takes for a single item. `"CombinedPrice"` is the amount extra it takes for each *additional* item.

Example: 
```json
"Price": 5,
"CombinedPrice": 2
```

Delivery fee for 1 item = $5

Delivery fee for 2 items = 5 + 2 = $7

Delivery fee for 3 items = 5 + 2(2) = $9

Delivery fee for 4 items = 5 + 4(2) = $13

#### Authentication
> Admin and merchant token only.

request.description:
| Parameter           | Description                          | Type    |
|---------------------|--------------------------------------|---------|
| ID                  | ID of the shipping address to delete | string  |
| Name                | Name of the Address - Home/Work      | string  |
| Line1               | First Line of the address            | string  |
| Line2               | Second Line of the address           | string  |
| PostCode            | Postal Code                          | string  |
| Delivery            | true if address is for delivery      | boolean |
| Pickup              | true if address is for pickup        | boolean |
| SpecialInstructions |                                      | string  |
| State               |                                      | string  |
| City                |                                      | string  |
| Country             |                                      | string  |
| CountryCode         | Example: SG for Singapore            | string  |

#### Authentication
> Admin and merchant token only.

request.description:
If you want to put data in a custom field you created, use this API to know in which reference table this custom field was assigned to.

Example:
* Reference Table: Users - Use [Update User Information](https://apiv2.arcadier.com/#cce29c0d-6faa-4ad8-8a83-d6ea4baddbb6) to store data in that custom field.
* Reference Table: Implementations -  Use [Update Marketplace information](https://apiv2.arcadier.com/#73471ada-ab82-42f3-bad4-af79f5e1714b) to store data in that custom field.
* Reference Table: Items - Use [Edit Item Details](https://apiv2.arcadier.com/?version=latest#8af9bf27-a3fb-4623-b8d0-f53a67697c47) to store data in that custom field.

#### Authentication
> Admin token only

request.description:
This API gets all custom fields (CF) that belong to all plug-ins that are installed on the marketplace. However, they don't show the value stored in each individual custom field. **They also won't show custom fields that are empty.**

To know the value stored:
* If a CF has reference table "Implementations", then if it has a value stored in it, you'll get it by calling the [Get Marketplace Info](https://apiv2.arcadier.com/#928eac76-5bee-4bf3-9484-293551f95cde) API.
* If a CF has reference table "Users", then if it has a value stored in it, you'll get it by calling the [Get User Info](https://apiv2.arcadier.com/#129fa6b1-1c39-4a41-b7b8-8aa7f2545394) API.
* If a CF has reference table "Items", then if it has a value stored in it, you'll get it by calling the [Get Item Details](https://apiv2.arcadier.com/?version=latest#a48c136d-a478-41b3-b647-66ef6c2dd440) API.

#### Authentication
> None required

request.description:
Gets the contents of a Custom Table you created for your Plug-In. For more information on Custom Tables, click [here](https://api.arcadier.com/overview-of-custom-tables).

Query Parameters for sorting: `?sort=`

* This takes the column name as value. For example, if you have a column called "Quantity" which stores integers, and you want to sort the response results in ascending order, the corresponding query parameter will be `?sort=Quantity`. If you want to sort in *descending* order, the query parameter will be `?sort=-Quantity`.
* You can also sort by the `ModifiedDateTime` and `CreatedDateTime` the same way: `?sort=ModifiedDateTime` or `?sort=CreatedDateTime`.


#### Authentication
> None

response.name: Get all Custom Table contents

#### Authentication
> None

Using the ID of a row, you can edit 1 or more row entries of that row. For more information on Custom Tables, click [here](https://api.arcadier.com/overview-of-custom-tables).

request.description:
Queries a table for its row entries. For more information on Custom Tables, click [here](https://api.arcadier.com/overview-of-custom-tables).

This API enables you to query and sort your custom tables.

Request parameters:

* "Name" - The column name
* "Operator": 
  * "equal" - look for an exact search term
  * "like" - look for rows that have a term similar to the search term
  * "lte" - look for rows with values **less** than or equal the search term
  * "gte" - look for rows with values **greater** than or equal the search term
* "Value" - The search term

#### Authentication
> Admin token only

#### Simple query
Querying for a specific value in one column:

There's a column name called "Phone Numbers", and you want to search for the row which has "999" in "Phone Numbers":

```json
[
    {
        "Name": "Phone Numbers",
        "Operator": "equal",
        "Value": "1234-5678"
    }
]
```

If only one row exists, the response will be:

```json
{
  "TotalRecords": 1,
  "PageNumber": 1,
  "PageSize": 1,
  "Records": [
    {
      "Id": "02ec5b74-ecc2-4c9c-9048-dbfc9de419ba",
      "Phone Numbers": "1234-5678"
    }
  ]
}
```
#### AND operation
You want to perform an AND operation on 2 or more columns. E.g: you stored some items in a custom tables and you want the items of merchant A who's item's prices are less than $100:

```json
[
    {
        "Name": "Price",
        "Operator": "lte",
        "Value": "100"
    },
    {
        "Name": "Merchant ID",
        "Operator": "equal",
        "Value": "36f957de-5cac-e911-80ec-000d3aa0a08d"
    }
]
```

The response will be an array of results similar to the first example.

item.description:
#### APIs to manage event triggers for your webhooks.

* [How to create and manage event triggers from the admin portal](https://github.com/Arcadier/Webhooks-Event-Triggers-and-Vetting/tree/master/(Core)%20Event%20Trigger%20Hooks#how-to-access)
* [Event triggers' Payloads](https://github.com/Arcadier/Webhooks-Event-Triggers-and-Vetting/tree/master/(Core)%20Event%20Trigger%20Hooks#payload-samples)
    * [invoice.paid](https://github.com/Arcadier/Webhooks-Event-Triggers-and-Vetting/tree/master/(Core)%20Event%20Trigger%20Hooks#1-invoice---invoicepaid)

#### Parameter definitions:
|Field|Required/Optional|Data Type|Description|
|:----:|:----:|:----:|:------|
|`"Id"`|Required|String| The GUID of the event trigger. Obtained after creating one.|
|`"Uri"`|Required|String|The URL of the webhook to connect to.|
|`"Filters": []`|Required|String|The event(s) to be used as trigger. The full list of events can be obtained [from your marketplace admin portal](https://github.com/Arcadier/Event-Triggers-and-Vetting/blob/master/Event%20Trigger%20Hooks/README.md#how-to-access) while attempting to create one.|
|`"Description"`|Optional|String|Brief description of what the event trigger is used for.|
|`"IsPaused"`|Optional|Boolean|If not specified, the default will be **false**. If set to **true**, the event trigger will become inactive, but still existing.|
|`"Headers" : {}`|Optional|Depends on header field|If the webhook URL requires any fields as headers, they can be specified here. Both the **key** and **value** can be edited here.|
|`"CustomProps": []`|Optional|String|Takes an array of strings if you wish to add custom properies to the event trigger.|

item.name: Leave ratings & feedback on purchased item

request.description:
Using the cartitemID from an existing order, you can leave a review on the item.
Ratings and feedback will be available on the item APIs as well

Successful response will be an integer corresponding to the id of the feedback created


* ItemRating = The no. of stars the item has (max 5 min 0)
* message = The string value of the feedback from the user

item.name: Get ratings & feedback from purchased item

request.description:
Get the rating and review created on the specific purchased item by the user
Successful response object will have these properties: FeedbackID (guid), ItemRating (int), and Message (string)

* ItemRating = The no. of stars the item has (max 5 min 0)
* message = The string value of the feedback from the user

item.name: Emails

request.description:
This API can send emails on behalf of the marketplace Admin to anyone with a valid email address. To write the message in HTML, your whole HTML code should be in one single line, i.e, no line breaks in the JSON body. Here is a list of things you need to know before writing HTML in the "Body" parameter: * Line breaks in your email can be inserted using ```
``` * Inverted commas `href="example"` should be written as `href=\"example\"` or `style="color:#fff"` should be written `style=\"color:#fff\"` * Links should always start as `http://` or `https://` #### Authentication > Admin Token only.

request.description:
Creates a specific column in the comparison table. That column will belong to an item chosen to be compared. Calling this API several times with a different `CartItemID`each time will create different columns.

### URL variables
`{{comparisonID}}` is obtained from a successfull [Create/Start Comparison](https://apiv2.arcadier.com/?version=latest#26e8cff2-fd0e-4422-a508-8e6a551b17c1) API call.

### Request Body

**Required**: `"CartItemID": "string"` - This is the CartItemID of the item added to cart by the buyer, which will be compared to other items in the users cart.

**Optional**: `"ComparisonFields": []` - This will take a list of custom fields (belonging to the item), that you wish to be used as properties to be put side by side and compared. 
* `"Key"` is the custom field code (Can be found in "[Get One Item's details](https://apiv2.arcadier.com/?version=latest#a48c136d-a478-41b3-b647-66ef6c2dd440)")
* `"Value"` is the value stored in the custom field (Can be found in "[Get One Item's details](https://apiv2.arcadier.com/?version=latest#a48c136d-a478-41b3-b647-66ef6c2dd440)")
* `"Key": "BuyerDescription"` and its corresponding value of found in "[Get One Item's details](https://apiv2.arcadier.com/?version=latest#a48c136d-a478-41b3-b647-66ef6c2dd440)" is required for the column to appear on the comparison page. 

#### Authentication
> Buyer token

After [Starting a comparison](https://apiv2.arcadier.com/?version=latest#26e8cff2-fd0e-4422-a508-8e6a551b17c1) **and** [Adding an item to the comparison table](https://apiv2.arcadier.com/?version=latest#741fa269-d5f3-434c-808e-01577e572eca), specific custom fields can be added as properties under that item. 


In this API, those custom fields are termed "ComparisonFields", and each call adds one custom field to the item being compared.

### Request Body

`"ComparisonDetailID": "string"` - This is the ID of the column resulting from [Adding an item to the comparison table](https://apiv2.arcadier.com/?version=latest#741fa269-d5f3-434c-808e-01577e572eca) 
* `"Key"` is the custom field `Code` (Can be found in "[Get One Item's details](https://apiv2.arcadier.com/?version=latest#a48c136d-a478-41b3-b647-66ef6c2dd440)")
* `"Value"` is the value stored in the custom field (Can be found in "[Get One Item's details](https://apiv2.arcadier.com/?version=latest#a48c136d-a478-41b3-b647-66ef6c2dd440)")
* `"Key": "BuyerDescription"` and its corresponding value of found in "[Get One Item's details](https://apiv2.arcadier.com/?version=latest#a48c136d-a478-41b3-b647-66ef6c2dd440)" is required for the column to appear on the comparison page.

Edits the properties of a comparison session.

#### Authentication
> Buyer token

Deletes a comparison session

#### Authentication
> Buyer token

Deletes one item being compared in a comparison session.

#### Authentication
> Buyer token

Deletes a list of one or more items being compared in a comparison session.

This list is sent as a query parameter, with each comparison detail ID separated by a comma as shown in the example.

    ]
}

request.description:
Creates a new custom payment gateway on the admin dashboard. The actual API linking to the payment gateway's has to be made manually on the dashboard.
Custom Fields need to be created separately, they aren't created here.

#### Authentication
> Admin token only

response.name: Admin - Create a new payment Gateway

request.description:
This API saves the details of the payment gateway in Arcadier's databases. It does not do the actual linking of the merchant's account to the Admin's account. The details to be filled in those parameters can be obtained from the `Merchant - Show Payment Acceptance Methods`.For clarification about how exactly to use this API, drop an email at `tanoo@arcadier.com`

#### Authentication
> Admin and merchant token only

{ "ID": "704d720d-d7d1-4171-bb68-a31ec49b5fa9", "Title": "CONTACT US", "Content": "
\r\n
\r\n

strAdmin_Contact_ContactUs

\r\n
\r\n

strAdmin_Contact_ContactDescription

\r\n

dbContactNo

\r\n

\r\n dbContactEmail\r\n

\r\n
", "ExternalURL": null, "CreatedDateTime": 1566198009, "ModifiedDateTime": 1566198009, "Active": true, "Available": null, "VisibleTo": null, "Meta": null }

request.description:
Creates a Page

"VisibleTo" take the following values:
* 0: Everyone
* 1: Merchants and Consumer only
* 2: MerchantOnly

"Available" takes the following values:
* 0: Publish
* 1: Hide

"Content" accepts HTML in a string.

#### Authenticaton
> Admin token only

response.name: Create Content Page

item.name: Partial Refunds

request.description:
Create a partial refund on a cart item within an order.

**Parameter definitions**
* userID (query Parameter) - *Which buyer does the order belong to*
* ID - Cart Item ID - can be retrieved from [Cart APIs](https://apiv2.arcadier.com/#eed5e49d-4578-4fbd-8701-815587c83b6d)/[Transaction APIs](https://apiv2.arcadier.com/#fd876791-d71f-43bd-be02-bfe6bf17747a)/[Order APIs](https://apiv2.arcadier.com/#098f3df5-dea8-478e-9259-b5e4b8ef4fae)
* Quanity - Integer of negative value which resprents the quantity of items to be refunded in a cart.(If not negative, the API will convert the number to negative) (e.g. Bought 5 of Item A, refund only 3 item A.. Quantity = -3)

Note:  Added Refund parameter to existing Get User Cart API

#### Authentication
> Buyer token only

Get the partial refunds of a specific user

When a partial refund is executed, the order's cart will have a boolean value of "True" for the refund field.
By querying this parameter, you can get the orders that have a partial refund

request.description:
This API allows you to get all order IDs that were refunded

It also allows you to filter via a timeframe where it goes by the refunded cartitem creation date. 
*i.e. You will be able to get refunds via the timestamp which the order was refunded, not when the order was created.*


#### Authorization: 
> Admin token only

item.description:
The user is able to make a partial refund on a specific item within the order (not the whole order)
The item will turn up as a new entry in the order with a negative value to the value of the specific item
The quantity of the item can also be edited via the refund (i.e. If user bought 3 items, but only wants to refund 2, it is possible)

Using this API gets all the location values defined in your location group. 

This list will be what your users select from for their location in their user settings page and the item creation page.

item.description:
How to setup your location ID group and the different locations within
This is needed to run the CRTY PRICING configuration on the API template

It enables sellers to create listings which can be divided into different locations, each with their own "Availability", "Stock", "Price" and "Bulk discount(s)"

request.description:
This API allows users to create quotation.

#### Definition of each request body parameters
* "FromUserID" - buyer/sender ID (Mandatory)
* "ToUserID" - seller/recipient ID (Mandatory)
* "CartItemID" - cartitem ID (Mandatory)
* "Total" - quotation total price (Mandatory)
* "CurrencyCode" - currency code (Mandatory)
* "ChannelID" - chat channel ID (Mandatory)
* "MessageType" - quotation message type, set to 'PRE-APPROVED' (Mandatory)
* "Message" - quotation message, null by default (Mandatory)
* "Accepted" - quotation accepted flag, value is true/false, set to false by default (Mandatory)
* "Declined" - quotation decline flag, value is true/false, set to false by default (Mandatory)
* "Quantity" - quotation quantity (Mandatory)
* "PaymentTermID" - payment term ID (Mandatory/Optional)
* "ValidStartDate" - quotation valid start date (Mandatory)
* "ValidEndDate" - quotation valid end date (Mandatory)
* "OfferDetails" -
  * "Name" - quotation reason (Mandatory/Optional)
  * "Description" - quotation description (Mandatory/Optional)
  * "Type" - quotation type if IsDiscount, set quotation as value, otherwise set to 'Quantity' (Mandatory)
  * "IsDiscount" - quotation discount flag value is true/false (Mandatory)
  * "Quantity" - quotation detail quantity (Mandatory)
  * "Price" - quotation price (Mandatory)
  * "Total Amount" - quotation total (Mandatory)

#### Authentication
> Admin token only

This API is used to only accept or decline quotation.
Please note the URL of this API it is "offer" and NOT "offers"

#### Definition of each request body parameters
* "Request" - 
  * "ID" - quotaton ID
  * "MessageType" - quotation message type, valid values are 'CANCELLED', 'ACCEPTED' and NULL/Empty(for declined quotation)
  * "Message" - quotation message
  * "Accepted" - quotation accepted flag, value is true/false, set to false by default

request.description:
This API is used for searching items in the marketplace by users. # Query Strings | Name | Data Type | Default | | :-------------: | :-------: | :-----: | | pageSize | Int | 24 | | pageNumber | Int | 1 | | Latitude | Decimal | Null | | Longitude | Decimal | Null | | withChildItems | Bool | False | | filterAvailable | Bool | True | | filterVisible | Bool | True | # Request body ``` { "FilterGroups":[ { "Filters":[ { "Field":"Name", "Value":"Test item name", "ConditionType":"Equal" } ] } ], "SortOrder":{ "Field":" Name ", "Direction":"Descending" }, "ReturnFields":["ID","Name","Price"] } ``` **NOTE:** The value for filters field name, condition type, sort order and return fields is **NOT** case sensitive. # How to use the request body * This search can do OR and AND operator filter. * To create OR filter, add new filter in Filters property. ``` "Filters":[ { "Field":"Name", "Value":"Test item name", "ConditionType":"Equal" }, { "Field":"Price", "Value":"100", "ConditionType":"Gt" } ] ``` * To create AND filter, add new filter in FilterGroups property ``` "FilterGroups":[ { "Filters":[ { "Field":"Name", "Value":"Test item name", "ConditionType":"Equal" } ] }, { "Filters":[ { "Field":"Price", "Value":"1000", "ConditionType":Gte" } ] } ], ``` # Filter Field Names * ID * Name * Keywords * CategoryID * VariantGroupID * VariantID * Price * Rating * CustomValue * ScheduleStartDate * ScheduleEndDateTime * CreatedDateTime * UpdatedDateTime * Tags * SellerID # Condition Type / Operators * Equal * Like (contains) * NotLike (not contain) * In (any) * Gte * Lte * Gt * Lt # Sort Field Names * ID * Name * Price * Rating * CreatedDateTime * UpdatedDateTime # Sort Direction * Ascending * Descending # Return Field Names * ID * SKU * Name * BuyerDescription * SellerDescription * Price * PriceUnit * StockLimited * StockQuantity * IsVisibleToCustomer * Active * IsAvailable * DateOfPurchase * Weight * WeightUnit * Cubes * CubeUnit * Length * LengthUnit * Width * WidthUnit * Height * HeightUnit * AdditionalDetails * CurrencyCode * ParentID * AverageRating * InstantBuy * Negotiation * Keywords * Distance * CreatedDatetime * ModifiedDatetime * HasChilditems * MerchantDetail * Location * Categories * ShippingMethods * PickupAddresses * Media * Tags * Scheduler * CustomFields * ChildItems * AddOns # | #### Authentication > Admin token only

Creates items in bulk. The request body is an array of objects, where each object is the item details of the items you want to create.

Once the request is sent, Arcadier's servers will take the items you submitted and save them in a batch to be created.

The response is received after the item list is checked for errors

#### Authentication
> Admin token

Edits items in bulk. The request body is an array of objects, where each object is the item details of the items you want to edit.

Each entry in the array needs the `ID` field, which is the GUID of the item.

Each entry requires the `CurrencyCode` and `Categories` fields. The category ID is the GUID of the category the item belongs to.

Once the request is sent, Arcadier's servers will take the items you submitted and save them in a batch to be edited.

The response is received after the item list is checked for errors

#### Authentication

> Admin token
